data.name: What am I left with?
data.description:
You've just earned your first paycheck, **Congratulations!**

However you've now discovered tax too...

The tax brackets are as follows for a years wage:
| Yearly Income | Tax Rate |
| ------ | -------- |
| Up to £12,570 | 0% |
| £12,571 to £50,270 | 20% |
| £50,271 to £150,000 | 40% |
| Over £150,000 | 45% |

But this isn't all...

National insurance is a thing too apparently, here are the rates per month:
| Monthly Income | National Insurance Rate |
| ------ | -------- |
| Up to £1,048 | 0% |
| £1,048 to £4,189 | 13.25% |
| Over £4,189 | 3.25% |

* It should be pointed out, National insurance is taken at a pre tax level
* Tax and NI are both rounded to the nearest whole number
* Your income will only ever be a positive whole number


Given my income, how much am I left with after these deductions for the year?
